subject: Re: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: ... You may find some errors but if you wrote some piece of code, you have normally written what you would expect.  If you write a letter, you normally don t
messageBody:
> "Make sure each line executes as you expect it to."


You may find some errors but if you wrote some piece of code, you have
normally written what you would expect. If you write a letter, you
normally don't find your own mistakes, even if you re-read the letter
several times.

When writing comments, I always enforce the rule "Comment what you mean,
not what you do". I like to use the same idea ("Test what you mean, not
what you do") when testing code.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
